memory.successful experience: In the first successful example, I found a CD in desk 2, took it, then found a desklamp on desk 1 and used it to examine the CD. In the second successful example, I found a soapbar in cabinet 4, cleaned it using the sink basin, and put it on countertop 1.
memory.failure reason: I failed to complete the task because the safe was closed and I did not open it before attempting to put the vase on it.
memory.suggestions: To successfully complete the task, I should have opened the safe first before trying to put the vase on it. For future reference, when dealing with items that can be opened or closed like safes, drawers, and cabinets, I should always check and make sure they are open before interacting with them.

memory.successful experience: From the successful experiences, I learned that planning is an important part of successfully completing a task. I started each task by thinking about what needed to be done and identifying the likely locations of the objects I needed. I then searched these locations systematically, one by one. Once I had found the required object, I performed the necessary action (taking, cleaning, heating) and finally moved to the location where the final action needed to be performed.
memory.failure reason: In the unsuccessful task, the repeated failure to put the heated mug in cabinets may be due to the fact that the cabinets were full or not suitable for keeping a hot cup. Or perhaps I haven't got the right to place objects in the cabinet.
memory.suggestions: I should examine the cabinet beforehand to make sure it is suitable and available for keeping the heated mug. If not, I should look for an alternative location, such as another cabinet or countertop. Also, I should review the instructions to ensure I have the permissions to perform the action.
